sendBinaryData.description: Whether binary data should be sent as body
sendBinaryData.title: Send Binary File

graphApiVersion.description: The version of the Graph API to be used in the request
graphApiVersion.title: Graph API Version

binaryPropertyName.description: For Form-Data Multipart, they can be provided in the format: "sendKey1:binaryProperty1,sendKey2:binaryProperty2
binaryPropertyName.title: Input Binary Field

queryParametersJson.description: The query parameters to send, defined as a JSON object
queryParametersJson.title: Query Parameters JSON

fields.description: The list of fields to request in the GET request
fields.title: Fields

httpRequestMethod.description: The HTTP Method to be used for the request
httpRequestMethod.title: HTTP Request Method

edge.description: Edge of the node on which to operate. Edges represent collections of objects which are attached to the node.
edge.title: Edge

node.description: The node on which to operate. A node is an individual object with a unique ID. For example, there are many User node objects, each with a unique ID representing a person on Facebook.
node.title: Node

hostUrl.description: The Host URL of the request. Almost all requests are passed to the graph.facebook.com host URL. The single exception is video uploads, which use graph-video.facebook.com.
hostUrl.title: Host URL

allowUnauthorizedCerts.description: Whether to connect even if SSL certificate validation is not possible
allowUnauthorizedCerts.title: Ignore SSL Issues

init_kwargs.title: Scade tools: Facebook Graph API
init_kwargs.description: Interacts with Facebook using the Graph API
